results.description: Uses recent momentum style loading to capture cross-sectional short-term continuation. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using the momentum factor; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). Coverage >0.6 so ts_backfill not needed (SUGGESTION3). Chose rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum because of high userCount (109) per SUGGESTION4. Kept implementation short and <=7 operators and <=2 datafields. Confidence set to 0.65 based on established momentum literature.

Combine momentum with residual volatility to downweight high-residual-volatility names. Applied SUGGESTION1 (2 datafields). No vector fields (SUGGESTION2). Coverage high so no ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Selected rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum and rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol for their high userCount. Abided by KEEP_IN_MIND on operator/datafield limits. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Short-term reversal on daily specific returns
results.description: Mean-reversion on idiosyncratic daily returns: short names with large positive specific returns and long negative. Used daily_specific_return (high userCount). Single datafield (SUGGESTION1 minimal). No vector ops (SUGGESTION2). Coverage 1.0 so no ts_backfill. Confidence 0.6 given typical mean-reversion horizon.

Short highly owned-by-hedge-funds, long low ownership, expecting de-risking flows to reverse. Applied SUGGESTION1 using hedge_fund_ownership_percent (very high userCount). Not a vector. Coverage 1.0 so no backfill. KEEP_IN_MIND met. Confidence 0.58.

Long stocks where hedge fund percent is increasing (momentum of ownership), short where it's falling. Uses ts_returns on hedge_fund_ownership_percent. SUGGESTION1 applied. No vector. Coverage good. Confidence 0.55.

Exploit extremes in short interest: short stocks with declining short interest (covering) and long where short interest increases. Used short_interest_factor_score (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied. Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.50.

Long stocks with high short interest and rising short interest (potential squeeze). Used multiply to combine level and recent change. SUGGESTION1 applied with two datafields: short_interest_factor_score and ts_returns(short_interest...). No vectors. Confidence 0.48.

Long small-cap stocks showing positive short-term returns anticipating size-based bounce. Used rsk70_mfm2_usfast_size and its short-term momentum. High userCount field used per SUGGESTION4. Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.52.

Long high value (rsk70_value) but low recent momentum; expect value catch-up. Applied SUGGESTION1 using rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value and rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum. Both high coverage and userCounts. No vector ops. Confidence 0.63.

Long names with rising earnings quality loading, short those declining. Used rsk70_mfm2_usfast_earnqlty (coverage ~0.9512). SUGGESTION3 not needed despite slightly below 1 because coverage >0.6. Confidence 0.57.

Short high earnings yield stocks that have run up recently, long low earnings yield that recently fell — capturing reversal in earnings-yield priced names. Used rsk70_mfm2_usfast_earnyild and its short-term returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.54.
Momentum on prospect style loading: long rising prospect, short falling. Used rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect (high coverage). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.
Long low residual-volatility stocks (rsk70_resvol) expecting lower risk to outperf on risk-adjusted basis. Single datafield per suggestion4. Confidence 0.59.

Short stocks with high specific_risk_variance and poor recent idiosyncratic returns, long opposite. Uses specific_risk_variance and daily_specific_return. Both have solid userCounts. Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.50.
Capture continuation in daily specific return: long names with positive recent specific returns. Used daily_specific_return (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 minimal. Confidence 0.61.

Momentum signal normalized by market cap to avoid microcap noise: ts_returns(momentum)/sqrt(marketcap). Uses rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum and current_market_cap_usd (high userCount). KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.58.
Rotate into stocks with falling market beta (rsk70_mfm2_usfast_beta) expecting outperformance in risk-off. Single datafield with ts_delta. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount beta field. Confidence 0.47.
Favor stocks whose dividend yield loading (rsk70_divyild) is increasing, indicative of improving income attractiveness. Coverage high and userCount large. Simple ts_returns used. Confidence 0.46.
